CEO apologizes for` shyster' comments David Shepardson/ The Detroit News San Francisco- Chrysler CEO Sergio Marchionne apologized today for describing the$ 12 billion U.S. government bailout that saved the company as shyster loans.`` Sergio Marchionne has repeatedly lamented the fact that the company paid more than$ 1.2 billion last year in interest on its loans. At a industry event here, Sergio Marchionne three times referred to the`` shyster loans that the U.S. and Canadian governments made to save Chrysler in 2009.`` I want to pay back the shyster loans,'' Sergio Marchionne said Friday.`` When we did this deal back in 2009, we

X Factor winner will get a$ 5 million( U.S.) recording contract with Syco, Simon Cowell 's joint venture with Sony Music. It's believed to be the biggest guaranteed prize in TV history. This is a guaranteed$ 5 million, payable to the winner. It will be paid$ 1 million each year for five years, Simon Cowell said.`` It is a massive, massive risk, but it is also an incredible incentive.
